snippet: The action helps Democrats in tight midterm election races, because it avoids the election-year cancellation of insurance policies that do not comply with the new health law.
abstract: Obama administration says it will allow consumers to renew health insurance policies that do not comply with the new health care law for two more years, pushing issue well beyond 2014 midterm elections; action reflects difficulty Pres Obama has faced in trying to build support for the Affordable Care Act amid uproar over his overstated pledge that people who liked their insurance plans could keep them, no matter what.
lead_paragraph: The action helps Democrats in tight midterm election races, because it avoids the election-year cancellation of insurance policies that do not comply with the new health law.

headline.main: Consumers Allowed to Keep Health Plans for Two More Years
headline.print_headline: Some Policies Get More Time in Health Shift

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
